verses.verse: Prayer for Israel’s Restoration To the leader: on Lilies, a Covenant. Of Asaph. A Psalm. (Ps 23.1; 77.20; 99.1) Give ear, O Shepherd of Israel, you who lead Joseph like a flock! You who are enthroned upon the cherubim, shine forth
(Ps 35.23) before Ephraim and Benjamin and Manasseh. Stir up your might, and come to save us!
(Num 6.25; Lam 5.21) Restore us, O God; let your face shine, that we may be saved.
(Ps 85.5) O LORD God of hosts, how long will you be angry with your people’s prayers?
(Ps 42.3; 102.9) You have fed them with the bread of tears and given them tears to drink in full measure.
(Ps 44.13; 79.4) You make us the scorn (Syr: Heb strife) of our neighbors; our enemies laugh among themselves.
Restore us, O God of hosts; let your face shine, that we may be saved.
(Ps 44.2; Isa 5.1, 7; Jer 2.21; Ezek 15.6) You brought a vine out of Egypt; you drove out the nations and planted it.
(Hos 14.5) You cleared the ground for it; it took deep root and filled the land.
The mountains were covered with its shade, the mighty cedars with its branches;
it sent out its branches to the sea and its shoots to the River.
(Ps 89.40; Nah 2.2) Why then have you broken down its walls, so that all who pass along the way pluck its fruit?
(Jer 5.6) The boar from the forest ravages it, and all that move in the field feed on it.
(Isa 63.15) Turn again, O God of hosts; look down from heaven and see; have regard for this vine,
the stock that your right hand planted. (Heb adds from 80.17 and upon the one whom you made strong for yourself)
(Ps 39.11; 76.6) It has been burned with fire; it has been cut down; may they perish at the rebuke of your countenance.
(Ps 89.21) But let your hand be upon the one at your right hand, the one whom you made strong for yourself.
(Ps 71.20; Isa 50.5) Then we will never turn back from you; give us life, and we will call on your name.
Restore us, O LORD God of hosts; let your face shine, that we may be saved.
